definitions.definition: A registry of pecuniary transactions ; a written or printed statement of business dealings or debts and credits , and also of other things subjected to a reckoning or review .
examples: The firm failed to file its accounts on time.
The money was refunded to her account .

definitions.definition: A statement in general of reasons, causes, grounds, etc., explanatory of some event; a reason of an action to be done.
examples: No satisfactory account has been given of these phenomena.

definitions.definition: A reason , grounds , consideration , motive ; a person's sake .
examples: Don't trouble yourself on my account .

definitions.definition: A record of events; a relation or narrative .
An estimate or estimation ; valuation ; judgment.
Authorization as a specific registered user in accessing a system .
examples: Since the system outage, I've been unable to log in to my account .

definitions.definition: A reckoning ; computation ; calculation ; enumeration ; a record of some reckoning.

examples: The young man soon turned his woodworking skills to some account .

main_definition: ( accounting ) A registry of pecuniary transactions ; a written or printed statement of business dealings or debts and credits , and also of other things subjected to a reckoning or review . [from c. 1300]
secondary_definitions: A statement in general of reasons, causes, grounds, etc., explanatory of some event; a reason of an action to be done.
A reason , grounds , consideration , motive ; a person's sake .
A record of events; a relation or narrative . [from c. 1610]
An estimate or estimation ; valuation ; judgment.
Authorization as a specific registered user in accessing a system .
( archaic ) A reckoning ; computation ; calculation ; enumeration ; a record of some reckoning.
